author: Alexandre Silberman
description: Saumil Prashantkumar Shah was set to stand trial over three weeks on six charges, three of dangerous driving causing death and three of causing death by criminal negligence. The trial by judge and jury was scheduled to begin June 20.
title: Driver pleads guilty to lesser charge in triple-fatal Moncton crash
content:
A man charged with dangerous driving causing the deaths of three college students in Moncton nearly three years ago pleaded guilty on Monday to a lesser charge.

author: Shane Magee
description: Six criminal charges were withdrawn against a Saint John man behind the wheel during a 2019 crash that killed three passengers. Saumil Prashantkumar Shah pleaded guilty to a single charge under the Motor Vehicle Act instead.
title: Criminal charges against driver withdrawn in Moncton crash that killed 3 people
content:

author: Shane Magee
description: Trial dates for two people accused of drug offences in Moncton couldn't be set Monday because one failed to show up in court. Difficulty finding time for the trial led to a judge raising concerns proposed trial dates could violate the rights of the accused.
title: Missing co-accused and busy court docket create scheduling trouble for Moncton drug case
content:
Trial dates for two people accused of drug offences in Moncton couldn't be set Monday because one of them failed to show up in court.
